question.text: Which of the following statements is not correct?

options.text: An action potential in an axon does not move backward because the segment behind is in a refractory phase
Depolarisation of hair cells of cochlea results in the opening of the mechanically gated potassium-ion channels
Rods are very sensitive and contribute to daylight vision
In the knee-jerk reflex, stimulus is the stretching of muscle and response is its contraction

solution.text: Option (c) is not correct because rods and cones are photoreceptor cells in our eyes. The rod cells contain a purple pigment rhodopsin that is useful in night vision or scotopic vision. Daylight (photopic) vision and colour vision are the functions of cones.
